section.name: s3
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: air conditioning plant (空氣調節機) includes any kind of mechanical ventilation system which contains a device for reducing or increasing the temperature of the air in any building or any part thereof below or above the temperature of the external air;
Director (署長) means the Director of Food and Environmental Hygiene; (78 of 1999 s. 7)
dressed poultry carcass (經處理的家禽屠體) means a poultry carcass from which the offal or feathers have been removed; (L.N. 171 of 1998)
food business (食物業) has the meaning assigned to it in section 4; (78 of 1999 s. 7)
food premises (食物業處所) means any premises on or from which there is carried on any food business and the expression premises (處所) includes a vessel and a stall;

food room (食物室) means any room, (being, or being part of, any food premises) where any person engages in the handling of open food or in the cleaning of equipment for the purposes of a food business, but does not include a room in which the only handling of food which occurs is in the course of serving food for consumption therein;

fresh (新鮮) in relation to beef, fish, game, meat, mutton, offal, pork, a poultry carcass, a reptile or shell fish, means beef, fish, game, meat, mutton, offal, pork, a poultry carcass, a reptile or shell fish which has not been subjected to a process of preservation; (L.N. 220 of 2001)
latrine fitment (廁所設備) means a fitment containing a receptacle for excrement, which is removable; (L.N. 495 of 1993)

def.name: Meat
def.leadIn: meat (肉類) means the flesh of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cattle (including buffaloes), goats, sheep and swine; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: horses, mules, hinnies and donkeys, if intended for human consumption;

subsection.def: offal (什臟) means the internal organs or intestines of a poultry; (L.N. 171 of 1998)

def.name: OpenFood
def.leadIn: open food (未加掩蓋的食物) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: uncooked perishable food; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: food not contained in a container of such materials, and so closed, as to exclude all risk of contamination,

def.continued: but does not include raw vegetables and uncut fruit or any food which has to be subjected to a process of milling, refining or cooking (other than food referred to in paragraph (a) and food in the course of preparation) for the purpose of rendering it fit for human consumption; (E.R. 1 of 2022)

subsection.def: plan (圖則) includes a sketch;
poultry carcass (家禽屠體) means the body of a dead poultry; (L.N. 171 of 1998)

def.name: Prepackaged
def.leadIn: pre-packaged (經預先包裝), in relation to any chilled beef, mutton or pork, means completely enclosed in a package in such a way that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the contents of the package cannot be altered without opening the package or changing the packaging; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the chilled beef, mutton or pork is ready for sale as a single food item; (L.N. 169 of 2006)

subsection.def: proprietor (東主) means the owner of or the person for the time being appearing to have charge of a food business and in the case of a licensed food business the licensee thereof;
sanitary fitment (衞生設備) includes any kind of ablution or sanitary facility;
sashimi (刺身) means food consisting of fillets of marine fish, molluscs, crustaceans, fish roe or other seafood to be eaten in raw state; (L.N. 407 of 1996)

shell fish (介貝類水產動物) means molluscs and crustaceans, but does not include molluscs or crustaceans in the form of sashimi or forming part of sushi, or oyster to be eaten in its raw state; (L.N. 407 of 1996; 78 of 1999 s. 7)
soil drain (污水渠) means any pipe or gutter which receives soil matter or which receives waste from a sanitary convenience;
soil fitment (污水設備) means a water-closet fitment, trough water-closet, urinal, slop sink, bidet or any similar fitment; (L.N. 495 of 1993)

sushi (壽司) means food consisting of cooked and pressed rice flavoured with vinegar and garnished with other food ingredients including raw or cooked or vinegared seafood, marine fish or shellfish roe, vegetable, cooked meat or egg on top or in the middle which may or may not be wrapped with seaweed and usually served in pieces; (L.N. 407 of 1996)
vending machine (售賣機) means a coin-operated automatic vending machine; (L.N. 212 of 1973)
water bird (水禽) means any bird that ordinarily lives on or feeds in water which may be used for human consumption and includes ducks and geese; (L.N. 171 of 1998)

wholesale market (批發市場) means any wholesale market established by the Director of Marketing or the Director of Agriculture, Fisheries and Conservation, but does not include the Western Wholesale Food Market. (L.N. 171 of 1998; 78 of 1999 s. 7; L.N. 331 of 1999)

subsection.content: A person shall be deemed for the purposes of this Regulation to engage in the handling of food if for the purposes of a food business he carries out or assists in the carrying out of any process or operation in the sale of food or in the preparation, transport, storage, packing, wrapping, exposure for sale, service, or delivery of food.

For the purposes of this Regulation, the supply of food, otherwise than by sale at, in or from any place where food is supplied in the course of a business, shall be deemed to be a sale of that food, and references to purchasing and purchasers shall be construed accordingly; and where in connection with any business in the course of which food is supplied the place where food is served to the customers is different from the place where the food is prepared, both those places shall be deemed to be places in which food is sold.

subsection.leadIn: In determining for the purposes of this Regulation whether any matter involves risk of contamination to any food, regard shall be had to the extent to which contamination in the respect in question is immaterial because of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nature of the food; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the manner in which the food is packed; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any process to which the food is to be subjected before sale to the consumer, being a process to which food of that nature is normally so subjected.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Interpretation of food business

subsection.def: In this Regulation, unless the context otherwise requires, the expression food business (食物業) means, subject to the succeeding provisions of this section, any trade or business for the purpose of which any person engages in the handling of food or food is sold by means of a vending machine. (L.N. 212 of 1973)

subsection.leadIn: The said expression does not include any agricultural activity, any canteen in any naval, military or air force establishment or provided in any school or work place (other than a factory canteen referred to in section 31) for the use exclusively of the pupils of the school and the persons employed in the work place, respectively, any club or (except so far as the handling of food may be involved in the course of a retail business or in the course of supplying food for immediate consumption) so much of any trade or business as consists of the handling of food at, in or upon— (L.N. 175 of 1980)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any dock or wharf; or (L.N. 125 of 1970)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except in the case of any business involving the transport of meat, whether cooked or uncooked, any premises or place occupied by a carrier of foods for the purposes of his trade as such a carrier; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any slaughterhouse; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any premises or place occupied by a wholesaler of raw vegetables and used exclusively for the purpose of his trade or business as such a wholesaler; or

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: are used exclusively for the storage of food manufactured and packed by the occupier thereof; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: are situated outside the curtilage of the premises used for the manufacture or packing of that food; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: are not used for the storage of any open food; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any warehouse, other than a warehouse in which articles of food are stored under refrigeration. (L.N. 125 of 1970)

part.name: P2
part.heading: General Requirements relating to Food Businesses

section.name: s5
section.heading: Cleanliness and repair of food premises

subsection.leadIn: Every person who carries on any food business shall at all times cause the walls, floors, doors, windows, ceiling, woodwork and all other parts of the structure of any food premises used by him in the course of such food business to be kept clean and free from noxious matters and to be kept in such good order, repair and condition as to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enable them to be effectively cleaned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prevent, so far as is reasonably practicable, infestation by rats, mice and insects and the entry of birds.

subsection.content: No person engaged in any food business shall place or permit to be placed or to remain placed any furniture or equipment, other than such as can be moved without difficulty by one man, so near to any wall in any food premises as to obstruct access to any part of such wall, or of such furniture or equipment, for the purpose of cleaning.

subsection.leadIn: No person engaged in any food business shall knowingly suffer or permit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in any food premises, the presence of rats, mice or insects; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any food room, the presence of live birds or animals.

subsection.content: If it appears to the Director on the report of any health officer or health inspector that any food premises, or any part thereof, are or is, by reason of uncleanliness or structural repair or condition, in such a state as to be unfit for use in any food business, the Director may cause a notice to be served upon the proprietor of such food business requiring him to cleanse, disinfest, limewash, repair or modify such food premises, or such part thereof, in such manner and within such time as shall be specified in the notice and, in the opinion of the Director, be necessary to render such premises or such part thereof fit for use as food premises. (10 of 1986 s. 32(2); 78 of 1999 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: If the proprietor fails to comply with any of the requirements of a notice served under subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he shall be guilty of an offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director may cause such work as may be necessary for compliance with the requirements of the notice to be carried out and may recover any expenses incurred thereby from the proprietor. (10 of 1986 s. 32(2); 78 of 1999 s. 7)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Cleanliness of equipment, etc.
section.content: Every person who carries on any food business shall at all times cause all furniture, articles, equipment and utensils used or liable to be used in the course of such business to be kept clean and free from noxious matters and in proper repair and free from cracks or chipping.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Prohibition of preparation of food in domestic premises
section.content: No person shall, for the purposes of any food business, give out any food, or arrange for or permit the giving out of any food, for preparation or packing by another person on or about any domestic premises.

section.name: s7A
section.heading: Prohibition of non-permitted colouring matter on food premises

subsection.content: No person engaged in any food business shall place or store or cause or permit to be placed or stored on any food premises any colouring matter for use in food which is not a permitted colouring matter.

subsection.def: In this section, permitted colouring matter (准許染色料) means any colouring matter, or a combination of more than one thereof, specified in the First Schedule to the Colouring Matter in Food Regulations (Cap. 132 sub. leg. H). (10 of 1986 s. 32(2); 78 of 1999 s. 7)

section.name: s8
section.heading: Prohibition of use of food rooms for dwelling purposes
section.content: No person shall use or permit the use of any food room for the purpose of a dwelling place, nor the use of any dwelling place as a food room.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Restriction on spitting

subsection.content: No person shall spit in any food room, and no person shall spit in any other part of any food premises except into a spittoon or other receptacle provided for that purpose.

Where the proprietor of any food business provides in any food premises spittoons or other receptacles, he shall cause each such spittoon or receptacle to contain disinfectant fluid and to be cleansed, and the fluid renewed, not less than once in every 24 hours.

In the case of any food business in respect of which a licence is required under Part IV, the proprietor thereof shall, unless exempted in writing by the Director, cause one or more notices prohibiting spitting, written in English and Chinese, to be continuously displayed in a conspicuous manner in every food premises. (10 of 1986 s. 32(2); 78 of 1999 s. 7)

section.name: s10
section.heading: Protection of food from risk of contamination
section.leadIn: Every person engaged in any food business shall, while so engaged, take all such steps as may be reasonably necessary to protect the food from risk of contamination or deterioration, and in particular, without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, no person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: so place, or cause, suffer or permit any other person so to place, any open food as to involve any risk of contamination; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: wrap up or otherwise bring any open food into direct contact with any printed newspaper or other unclean paper or wrapping material.

section.name: s10A
section.heading: Control of water quality

subsection.content: No person shall in the course of any food business keep any live fish or shell fish intended for human consumption in water of a quality below the standard specified by the Director by notice published in the Gazette.

subsection.def: In this section, food business (食物業) includes any trade or business for the purpose of which live fish or shell fish is sold or is intended to be sold for human consumption.

section.name: s10AB
section.heading: Seawater extracted from prohibited areas

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: food business (食物業) has the same meaning as in section 10A(3);
prohibited area (禁區) means an area specified in Schedule 1A.

subsection.content: A person shall not extract seawater from a prohibited area for the purpose of keeping by that person, in the course of any food business, any live fish or shell fish that is intended for human consumption.

A person shall not use for the purpose of keeping, in the course of any food business, any live fish or shell fish that is intended for human consumption seawater knowing or having reason to believe that it is extracted from a prohibited area.

A person shall not extract seawater from a prohibited area knowing or having reason to believe that it is to be used by another person for the purpose of keeping, in the course of any food business, any live fish or shell fish that is intended for human consumption.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not supply, deliver or cause to be delivered, to another person seawater knowing or having reason to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is extracted from a prohibited area; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is to be used for the purpose of keeping, in the course of any food business, any live fish or shell fish that is intended for human consumption.

section.name: s10B
section.heading: Prohibition of dogs on food premises

subsection.content: No person shall bring any dog onto any food premises.
No person engaged in any food business shall knowingly suffer or permit the presence of any dog on any food premises.

Nothing in this section shall be construed to prohibit the presence on any food premises (other than a food room) of a dog serving as a guide for a totally or partially blind person, or to prohibit the presence on any food premises of a dog in connection with the exercise of a lawful power. (78 of 1999 s. 7)

section.name: s11
section.heading: Storage of open food

content.leadIn: No person in the course of any food business shall store (including display for sale) or suffer or permit the storage of any open food other than uncooked perishable food, except in a suitable container so designed and constructed as to prevent, so far as is reasonably practicable, the access of dust, insects and vermin:
content.proviso: Provided that nothing in this subsection shall be construed to prevent such reasonable exposure of food as may be necessary in the course of carrying on the business.

subsection.content: No person shall knowingly suffer the existence of any dust, insects or vermin within any such container referred to in subsection (1).

section.name: s12
section.heading: Transport of open food
section.content: No person in the course of any food business shall transport, or cause, suffer or permit to be transported, any open food in the open air except so far as may be necessary for the purpose of loading or unloading any vehicle or container, unless such open food is adequately protected by suitable material from risk of contamination or deterioration.

section.name: s12A
section.heading: Requirements for transportation of dressed poultry carcass or offal

subsection.content: No person shall, in the course of any food business, transport or cause, suffer or permit to be transported, the whole or part of a dressed poultry carcass or offal removed from a poultry except in a goods vehicle approved in writing by the Director and subject to such conditions as he thinks fit.
Notwithstanding subsection (1), the Director may give consent to transportation by other means of conveyance subject to such conditions as he thinks fit.
Any approval or consent given by the Director under subsection (1) or (2) may be withdrawn at any time by giving written notice.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Restriction on the use of open spaces

subsection.content: No person shall for the purpose of any food business use, or cause, suffer or permit to be used, any yard, alley, street, open space, roof top or open deck space for the preparation or storage of open food or for the washing, cleansing or storage of any equipment or utensil used in the preparation or service of food.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in this section shall be construed to prevent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any process in the manufacture or preparation of food in the open air which could not reasonably be carried on elsewhere having regard to the circumstances; but where the process of the trade necessitates the use of open spaces, every such open space shall be surfaced and drained to the satisfaction of the Director; or

content.leadIn: the carrying on of any food business from a stall:
content.proviso: Provided that for the purpose of this paragraph no open food shall be placed lower than 450 mm from the ground unless it is adequately protected from any risk of contamination. (L.N. 89 of 1979; 10 of 1986 s. 32(2); 78 of 1999 s. 7)

section.name: s14
section.heading: Use of wet refrigerators, etc.
section.content: No person in the course of any food business shall keep, or cause, suffer or permit to be kept, any drink contained in bottles in a wet refrigerator or immersion cooler unless such bottles are placed in an upright position and the level of the water in the refrigerator or cooler, as the case may be, is not less than 75 mm below the mouths of the bottles.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Cleanliness and repair of food rooms

subsection.leadIn: The walls, floors, doors, ceilings, woodwork and all other parts of the structure of every food room shall be kept clean and shall be kept in such good order, repair and condition as to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enable them to be effectively cleaned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prevent, so far as is reasonably practicable, any risk of infestation by rats, mice or insects or the entry of birds.

subsection.leadIn: Where any works affecting the structure of a food room, other than mere removal of part of the structure, are executed, the structure affected by such works shall after the completion of the works be such as to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enable it to be effectively cleaned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prevent, so far as is reasonably practicable, any risk of infestation by rats, mice and insects and the entry of birds.

section.name: s15A
section.heading: Cleanliness and repair of sanitary fitments
section.content: Every sanitary fitment shall at all times be maintained in a clean and sanitary condition and shall be kept in good order and repair.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Accumulation of refuse in food rooms
section.content: No refuse or filth, whether solid or liquid, shall be deposited or allowed to accumulate in a food room except so far as may be unavoidable for the proper carrying on of the food business.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Certain tables, etc. to be surfaced with hardwood or impervious material
section.content: No proprietor shall use, or suffer or permit to be used, in the preparation of any food, any table, sideboard, bench or like article of furniture the surface of which comes into contact with any food, or is liable to come into contact with any food, unless such surface is made of smooth close jointed hardwood or a smooth impervious material.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Prevention of lying or sitting on certain tables, etc.
section.content: No person shall lie down, sit or stand upon any table, sideboard, bench or other article of furniture the surface of which comes into contact with any food or is liable to come into contact with any food.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Sterilization and storage of utensils
section.leadIn: No person engaged in any food business shall use, or cause, suffer or permit to be used, in the course of such food business any crockery, glassware or other utensil used in the preparation or consumption of food, which has not, since the last occasion on which it was used for any purpose, been—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: washed clean and thereafter immersed in boiling water, other than the water used for the washing thereof, for not less than one minute; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: washed clean and thereafter immersed for a period of at least one minute and at a temperature of not less than 24 degrees Celsius in an effective and non-toxic solution of a bactericidal agent approved by the Director; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: mechanically washed clean in an apparatus which has been manufactured and sold for the washing of crockery, glassware or other utensils of the type for the washing of which such apparatus is being used and is of a type approved by the Director; and (10 of 1986 s. 32(2); 78 of 1999 s. 7)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: dried by evaporation or with a clean, light coloured drying cloth; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: unless immediately required for further use, stored in a cupboard which has been rendered proof against the access of dust, insects and vermin.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Cleansing of napkins, etc.
section.content: No person engaged in any food business involving the serving of meals to customers shall provide for the use of any customer any napkin or cleansing towel unless, since the last preceding occasion upon which such napkin or cleansing towel was used for any purpose, it has been washed and immersed for not less than one minute in boiling water used exclusively for that purpose.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Prevention of contamination by contact with clothing
section.content: No person engaged in any food business shall hang up or otherwise place any garments while not in use in such a place or in such a manner as to, or to be liable to, come into contact with or to be suspended directly above any open food, and no person shall hang up or otherwise place any such garments in any food room.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Personal cleanliness
section.leadIn: Every person who engages in the handling of food in any food business shall while so engaged—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep as clean as may be reasonably practicable all parts of his person which may be liable to come into contact with food;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: keep as clean as may be reasonably practicable all parts of his clothing, overclothing or overalls which may be liable to come into contact with food;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: keep any open cut or abrasion on any exposed part of his person covered with a suitable waterproof dressing;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: refrain from the use of tobacco while he is handling any open food or is in any food room.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Immunization of persons engaged in food businesses against certain diseases

subsection.leadIn: No person shall be engaged in or take any part in any food business unless he has been—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immunized, in accordance with such of the requirements of a notification under subsection (3) as apply to him.

subsection.content: Failure by any person engaged in or taking part in any such food business as may be specified by notification under subsection (3), on demand to produce for inspection by any health inspector or health officer a valid certificate of immunization against such disease as may be so specified shall be prima facie evidence in any court of the commission by such person of a contravention of the provisions of subsection (1).

The Director may from time to time by notification published in the Gazette require persons employed in or taking part in all or any particular food businesses to be immunized against such diseases as shall be specified in such notification. (10 of 1986 s. 32(2))

section.name: s23A
section.heading: Prohibition of employment in food businesses of persons not immunized against certain diseases

subsection.leadIn: No proprietor of any food business, or, as the case may be, of any such food business as may be specified by notification under section 23(3), shall employ any person in, or cause or permit any person to be engaged in or to take part in, such business unless that person—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has been immunized in accordance with such of the requirements of a notification under section 23(3) as apply to that person. (L.N. 181 of 1978)

subsection.content: Failure by the proprietor of any such food business as may be so specified, on demand to obtain the production of, or to produce, for inspection by any health inspector or health officer a valid certificate of immunization against such disease as may be so specified, or a certified copy thereof, showing that any person employed, engaged or taking part in such business, has been so immunized shall be prima facie evidence in any court of the commission by him of a contravention of the provisions of subsection (1). (L.N. 164 of 1982)

section.name: s24
section.heading: Restriction on employment of persons likely to spread diseases

content.leadIn: No person engaged in any food business who is suffering from a discharging wound or sore on any exposed part of the body, or from a discharge of the ear or from attacks of diarrhoea or vomiting or from a sore throat shall take any part in the handling of open food:
content.proviso: Provided that a health officer may issue a certificate in writing to such person exempting him from this subsection in any case in which such health officer is satisfied that no danger to the public health is involved.

subsection.content: Any person engaged in the course of any food business in any food room or in any room in which food is served or in the handling of open food shall, if so required in writing by a health officer, submit himself to medical examination at such time and place as such health officer shall direct and if, after medical examination, a health officer is satisfied that such person is suffering from any communicable disease, or is likely to communicate to any other person any communicable disease, such health officer may notify such person in writing to that effect and thereafter such person shall forthwith cease to work or take part in the same or any other food business.
A notification made under subsection (2) shall remain effective until cancelled by a further notification by a health officer declaring such first mentioned notification to be cancelled.

Subject to the proviso to subsection (1), no person shall cause, suffer or permit any other person whom he knows or has reason to believe to be suffering from any of the complaints mentioned in subsection (1) to take any part in the handling of open food in any food business; and no person shall cause or suffer or permit any other person in respect of whom he knows or has reason to believe a notification made under subsection (2) is effective to be engaged in the course of any food business in any food room or in any room in which food is served or in the handling of any open food.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Inspection books, etc.

subsection.content: The Director may in his discretion supply to any food business an inspection book or form for the use of health inspectors.

Where such inspection book or form is provided by the Director, the proprietor of the food business to which it has been supplied shall cause it to be kept at all times on the food premises concerned and available for use by any health inspector visiting the premises.
No person shall destroy any such book or form or alter or obliterate any entry made therein.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Horse flesh to be labelled as such
section.content: Where in the course of any food business the flesh of any horse, mule, hinny or donkey is sold, or offered or exposed for sale, it shall, at the time of the sale, or offer or exposure for sale, be clearly labelled “HORSE FLESH” in English lettering and Chinese characters of sufficient size to be easily legible to every customer.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Prohibition against the collection of shell fish in certain areas
section.leadIn: No person shall collect for sale for human consumption any shell fish in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the harbour; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the harbour in Aberdeen, being all those waters and foreshores bounded by a line drawn north from the westernmost extremity of the Island of Ap Lei Chau and a line drawn east from the southernmost extremity of that island.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Prohibition of the sale, etc. of articles specified in Schedule 1
section.content: No person shall sell, or offer or expose for sale, or possess for sale or for use in the preparation of any article of food for sale, any of the foods specified in Schedule 1.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Restriction on sale, etc. of specified articles

subsection.leadIn: Save with the permission in writing of the Director, no person shall—

content.leadIn: sell or offer or expose for sale, or possess for sale or for use in the preparation of any article of food for sale, any of the foods specified in items 1 to 5 inclusive, items 9 to 14 inclusive and items 16 to 21 inclusive of Schedule 2: (L.N. 212 of 1973; L.N. 407 of 1996; L.N. 1 of 1999)
content.proviso: Provided that this paragraph shall not apply to the hawking of live poultry in any place or area for the time being set aside by the Director pursuant to section 4(1)(a) of the Hawker Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. AI);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sell or offer or expose for sale, or possess for sale any of the foods specified in items 6, 7, 8 and 15 of Schedule 2 unless such food is contained in an unopened hermetically sealed container; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: possess for use in the preparation of any article of food for sale any of the foods specified in items 6, 7, 8 and 15 of Schedule 2 unless such food is, until the time it is about to be so used, contained in an unopened hermetically sealed container. (L.N. 125 of 1970)

subsection.name: 1AA
subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to item 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 18, 19 or 20 of Schedule 2 if the sale, or the preparation for sale, of the item is carried on under and in accordance with a composite food shop licence. (L.N. 57 of 2010)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Save with the permission in writing of the Director, no person shall sell, or offer or expose for sale, or possess for sale a fresh, chilled or frozen water bird carcass—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: at premises where there are live poultry, unless the water bird carcass—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a dressed water bird carcass; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is packed separately in a container closed in a manner that ensures that the carcass is securely contained within it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: at any other premises, unless the water bird carcass—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a dressed water bird carcass; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is packed separately or only with one or more other water bird carcasses in a container. (L.N. 220 of 2001)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: Subsection (1A)(a) does not apply in relation to the sale, or offer or exposure for sale, or possession for sale of any water bird carcass at the Western Wholesale Food Market. (L.N. 220 of 2001)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.leadIn: Save with the permission in writing of the Director, no person shall deliver or cause to be delivered—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to premises where there are live poultry, or to any person at such premises, for the purpose of sale, a fresh, chilled or frozen water bird carcass, unless the water bird carcass—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a dressed water bird carcass; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is packed separately in a container closed in a manner that ensures that the carcass is securely contained within it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to any other premises, or to any person at such premises, for the purpose of sale, a fresh, chilled or frozen water bird carcass, unless the water bird carcass—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a dressed water bird carcass; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is packed separately or only with one or more other water bird carcasses in a container closed in a manner that ensures that the carcass or carcasses is or are securely contained within it. (L.N. 220 of 2001)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.content: Subsection (1C)(a) does not apply in relation to the delivery of any water bird carcass within the Western Wholesale Food Market. (L.N. 220 of 2001)

subsection.name: 1E
subsection.leadIn: Save with the permission in writing of the Director, no person shall sell, or offer or expose for sale, or possess for sale—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at premises where there are live poultry any fresh, chilled or frozen offal removed from a water bird, unless the offal is packed, separately or only with the offal removed from the same or any other water bird, in an unopened hermetically sealed container; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at any other premises any fresh, chilled or frozen offal removed from a water bird, unless the offal is packed, separately or only with the offal removed from the same or any other water bird, in a container. (L.N. 220 of 2001)

subsection.name: 1F
subsection.content: Subsection (1E)(a) does not apply in relation to the sale, or offer or exposure for sale, or possession for sale of any offal of a water bird at the Western Wholesale Food Market. (L.N. 220 of 2001)

subsection.name: 1G
subsection.leadIn: Save with the permission in writing of the Director, no person shall deliver or cause to be delivered—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to premises where there are live poultry, or to any person at such premises, for the purpose of sale, any fresh, chilled or frozen offal removed from a water bird, unless the offal is packed, separately or only with the offal removed from the same or any other water bird, in an unopened hermetically sealed container; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to any other premises, or to any person at such premises, for the purpose of sale, any fresh, chilled or frozen offal removed from a water bird, unless the offal is packed, separately or only with the offal removed from the same or any other water bird, in a container. (L.N. 220 of 2001)

subsection.name: 1H
subsection.content: Subsection (1G)(a) does not apply in relation to the delivery of any offal of a water bird within the Western Wholesale Food Market. (L.N. 220 of 2001)

subsection.leadIn: Every permission granted under subsection (1), (1A), (1C), (1E) or (1G) shall— (L.N. 220 of 2001)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if granted to an applicant who is already in possession of a valid licence granted by the Director under any of the following Regulations, namely—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: this Regulation,

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Milk Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. AQ),

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the Frozen Confections Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. AC),

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the Hawker Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. AI),

subsection.continued: be granted free of charge and shall, subject to section 30AA(2), be valid for so long as the licence is valid;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if granted to an applicant who is the lessee of a market stall leased to him—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by the Director under the provisions of the Public Markets Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. BO), or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by the owner, within the meaning of the Private Markets Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. BG), of a private market under the provisions of that Regulation,

paragraph.continued: be granted free of charge and shall, subject to section 30AA(2), be valid for the duration of the lease; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if granted to an applicant to whom neither paragraph (a) nor paragraph (b) applies, subject to section 30AA(2), be valid for a period of 12 months from and including the date on which such permission is granted and shall be granted subject to the payment in advance to the Director of the prescribed fee. (L.N. 495 of 1993; L.N. 85 of 1995; L.N. 185 of 2008)

subsection.content: Where the Director is satisfied that any permission granted under this section has been lost, destroyed or accidentally defaced, the Director may, upon payment of the prescribed fee, issue a duplicate thereof. (L.N. 209 of 1983; L.N. 33 of 1987; L.N. 63 of 1988; L.N. 54 of 1991; L.N. 54 of 1992; L.N. 59 of 1993; L.N. 142 of 1994; L.N. 85 of 1995)
For the avoidance of doubt, nothing in this section shall be construed to exempt any person from complying with any other licensing requirements prescribed by this or any other Regulation.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, by notice in the Gazette, exempt from all or any of the prohibitions in subsection (1), (1A), (1C), (1E) or (1G), either generally or in any particular case, the following persons or any such person or class of such persons— (L.N. 220 of 2001)

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: any person who is a lessee of a market stall referred to in subsection (2)(b). (L.N. 181 of 1978)

subsection.content: An exemption granted under subsection (5) may be amended or revoked at any time by the Director by notice in the Gazette. (L.N. 181 of 1978)

subsection.def: For the purposes of this section, dressed water bird carcass (經處理的水禽屠體) means a water bird carcass from which the alimentary tract, liver and feathers have been removed. (L.N. 220 of 2001)

section.name: s30AA
section.heading: No live poultry at retail premises overnight

subsection.leadIn: A permittee shall ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: each day, before 8:00 p.m., all live poultry remaining at the relevant permitted premises (whether sold or unsold) is slaughtered; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is no live poultry at the permitted premises between 8:00 p.m. each day and 5:00 a.m. the next day.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: If a black rainstorm warning or a gale warning is in force at any time between noon and 8:00 p.m. on a day, a permittee is exempt from compliance with subsection (1)(a) on that day and from compliance with subsection (1)(b) between 8:00 p.m. that day and 5:00 a.m. the next day. (L.N. 242 of 2008)
Without limiting any other powers the Director has in respect of the revocation of a permission, the Director may revoke the relevant permission if subsection (1) is contravened.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: black rainstorm warning (黑色暴雨警告) has the meaning given to it by section 71(2) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1); (L.N. 242 of 2008)
gale warning (烈風警告) has the meaning given to it by section 71(2) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1); (L.N. 242 of 2008)
permission (准許) means a permission granted under section 30(1)(a) in respect of any food specified in item 4(a) and (b) of Schedule 2;

permitted premises (獲准許處所), in relation to a permission, means the premises at which the relevant permittee is permitted to sell or offer or expose for sale, or possess for sale or for use in the preparation of any article of food for sale, any food specified in item 4(a) and (b) of Schedule 2;
permittee (獲准許人士) means a person who has been granted a permission.

section.name: s30A
section.heading: Restriction on the possession for sale of live poultry specified in Schedule 2
section.content: No person shall possess for sale any live water bird specified in item 4(a) of Schedule 2 and any live poultry specified in item 4(b) of that Schedule in the same premises.

section.name: s30B
section.heading: Restriction on possession for sale of live quails
section.content: A person shall not possess for sale live quails with any other live poultry at the same premises.

section.name: s30C
section.heading: Further restrictions on trading of fresh, chilled and frozen offal of water birds at retail level

subsection.leadIn: Unless with reasonable excuse, no person having possession for sale any offal of a water bird contained in a sealed container shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: open; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other way tamper with,

subsection.continued: the container at premises at which the offal is possessed for sale, if there are live poultry at those premises.

subsection.content: This section does not apply in relation to the Western Wholesale Food Market.

subsection.def: In this section, sealed container (加封容器) means a container required to be sealed in accordance with section 30(1E)(a).

section.name: s30D
section.heading: Restriction on sale, etc. of chilled beef, mutton or pork

subsection.content: No person shall sell, or offer or expose for sale, or possess for sale fresh beef, mutton or pork and chilled beef, mutton or pork at the same premises.
No person shall sell, or offer or expose for sale, or possess for sale fresh beef, mutton or pork and chilled beef, mutton or pork at the same market stall.

subsection.def: In subsection (1), premises (處所) means the premises on which the business of a fresh provision shop is carried on.

section.name: s30E
section.heading: Exception to restriction on sale, etc. of chilled beef, mutton or pork

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chilled beef, mutton or pork concerned is pre-packaged;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it has been packaged in a place other than in the premises or market stall referred to in that section; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the package is marked and labelled in the manner prescribed in Schedule 6.

section.name: s30F
section.heading: Further restrictions on trading of pre-packaged chilled beef, mutton or pork at retail level
section.content: Unless with reasonable excuse, no person having the possession for sale of any pre-packaged chilled beef, mutton or pork at any premises referred to in section 30D or market stall shall open, or in any other way tamper with, the package at the premises or market stall.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Licensing of food business

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 33C, except under and in accordance with a licence granted by the Director under this Regulation, no person shall carry on or cause, permit or suffer to be carried on any of the following food businesses— (L.N. 212 of 1973; L.N. 493 of 1995)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any food factory; or (L.N. 57 of 2010)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any restaurant; or

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: any factory canteen; or (L.N. 175 of 1980)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any siu mei and lo mei shop; or (L.N. 57 of 2010)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any fresh provision shop; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any cold store; or (L.N. 125 of 1970; L.N. 57 of 2010)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any composite food shop. (L.N. 57 of 2010)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: If a food business involves only either or both of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the sale of all or any of the foods or classes of food specified in Part 2 of Schedule 2A for human consumption off the premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the sale of food by a vending machine for human consumption off the premises,

subsection.continued: and the food business is carried on in compliance with section 30(1), subsection (1) does not apply to the food business. (L.N. 57 of 2010)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Regulation, the expression— (L.N. 493 of 1995)
subsection.def: authorized person (認可人士) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123); (L.N. 57 of 2010)
cold store (凍房) means any warehouse in which articles of food are stored under refrigeration; (L.N. 125 of 1970)

def.name: CompositeFoodShop
def.leadIn: composite food shop (綜合食物店) means any food business which involves—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the sale and preparation for sale of all or any of the foods or classes of food specified in Part 1 of Schedule 2A;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the sale of all or any of the foods or classes of food specified in Part 2 of that Schedule;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the reheating of pre-cooked food for sale; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the sale of food by a vending machine,

def.continued: for human consumption off the premises; (L.N. 57 of 2010)

subsection.def: composite food shop licence (綜合食物店牌照) means a licence granted under this section in respect of a composite food shop; (L.N. 57 of 2010)
factory (工廠) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Factories and Industrial Undertakings Ordinance (Cap. 59); (L.N. 175 of 1980)
factory building (工廠大廈) means any building which contains one or more factories; (L.N. 175 of 1980)

factory canteen (工廠食堂) means any food business in a factory building which involves the sale or supply of meals or unbottled non-alcoholic drinks other than Chinese herb tea for consumption on the premises by persons employed in any factory in that factory building, but does not include a restaurant or any business carried on by a hawker who is the holder of a licence under the Hawker Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. AI); (L.N. 175 of 1980; 78 of 1999 s. 7)

food factory (食物製造廠) means any food business which involves the preparation of food for sale for human consumption off the premises, but does not include a frozen confection factory, a milk factory or any business carried on by a hawker who is the holder of a licence under the Hawker Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. AI); (L.N. 125 of 1970; 78 of 1999 s. 7; L.N. 57 of 2010)

fresh provision shop (新鮮糧食店) means any food business which involves the sale of fresh, chilled or frozen beef, mutton, pork, reptiles (including live reptiles), fish (including live fish) or poultry (including live poultry), but does not include a restaurant, factory canteen, market stall or any business carried on by a hawker who is the holder of a licence under the Hawker Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. AI); (L.N. 125 of 1970; L.N. 212 of 1973; L.N. 152 of 1976; L.N. 175 of 1980; 78 of 1999 s. 7; L.N. 220 of 2001)

frozen confection factory (冰凍甜點製造廠) means any food business which involves, within the meaning of the Frozen Confections Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. AC), the manufacture of any frozen confection; (78 of 1999 s. 7)
full licence (正式牌照) means a licence other than a provisional licence or a temporary licence; (L.N. 493 of 1995)
general restaurant (普通食肆) means a restaurant other than a light refreshment restaurant; (L.N. 57 of 2010)
licensee (持牌人) means a person to whom a full licence, a provisional licence or a temporary licence has been granted under this Regulation; (L.N. 493 of 1995; 78 of 1999 s. 7)
light refreshment restaurant (小食食肆) means a restaurant selling only light refreshments; (L.N. 57 of 2010)

milk factory (奶品廠) means any food business which involves, within the meaning of the Milk Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. AQ), the processing or reconstitution of milk or any milk beverage; (L.N. 216 of 1977; 78 of 1999 s. 7)
provisional licence (暫准牌照) means a licence granted under section 33C; (L.N. 493 of 1995; 78 of 1999 s. 7)
registered structural engineer (註冊結構工程師) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123); (L.N. 57 of 2010)

restaurant (食肆) means any food business which involves the sale of meals or unbottled non-alcoholic drinks other than Chinese herb tea, for consumption on the premises, but does not include a factory canteen or any business carried on by a hawker who is the holder of a licence under the Hawker Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. AI); (L.N. 125 of 1970; L.N. 175 of 1980; 78 of 1999 s. 7)

siu mei and lo mei shop (燒味及鹵味店) means any food business which involves the sale by retail of siu mei or lo mei, but does not include a restaurant, factory canteen or any business carried on by a hawker who is the holder of a licence under the Hawker Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. AI); (L.N. 125 of 1970; L.N. 175 of 1980; 78 of 1999 s. 7)
temporary licence (臨時牌照) means a licence granted under paragraph (b) of the proviso to subsection (5). (L.N. 493 of 1995; 78 of 1999 s. 7; L.N. 57 of 2010; E.R. 1 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to anything contained in the Ordinance relating to licences, any licence granted under this section may be subject to any or all of the following conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a condition prohibiting or restricting the carrying on at or from the food premises to which such licence relates of any particular kind of food business;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a condition prohibiting or restricting the carrying on at or from the food premises to which such licence relates of any kind of business other than that specified in the licence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a condition prohibiting or restricting the sale to customers at or from the food premises to which such licence relates of any food or class of food other than the food or class of food that is specified in the licence; (L.N. 125 of 1970; L.N. 57 of 2010)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of a composite food shop licence, a condition prohibiting or restricting the preparation for sale at the food premises to which the licence relates of any food or class of food other than the food or class of food that is specified in the licence. (L.N. 57 of 2010)

subsection.content: A full licence shall be valid for a period of 12 months from and including the date of its issue. (L.N. 493 of 1995)

content.leadIn: The grant or renewal of a full licence shall be subject to the payment in advance to the Director of the prescribed fee for the class of licence issued: (L.N. 493 of 1995)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that a temporary licence for any period not exceeding 7 days may be granted upon payment of the prescribed fee. (L.N. 209 of 1983; L.N. 33 of 1987; L.N. 63 of 1988; L.N. 97 of 1989; L.N. 74 of 1990; L.N. 54 of 1991; L.N. 54 of 1992; L.N. 59 of 1993; L.N. 142 of 1994; L.N. 85 of 1995)

subsection.content: Where the Director is satisfied that any licence granted under this Regulation is lost, destroyed or accidentally defaced, the Director may, upon payment of the prescribed fee, issue a duplicate thereof. (L.N. 209 of 1983; L.N. 33 of 1987; L.N. 63 of 1988; L.N. 97 of 1989; L.N. 74 of 1990; L.N. 54 of 1991; L.N. 54 of 1992; L.N. 59 of 1993; L.N. 142 of 1994; L.N. 85 of 1995)

The Director may, by notice in the Gazette, exempt from the prohibition in subsection (1), either generally or in any particular case, any person who carries on any food business or class of food business mentioned in that subsection. (L.N. 181 of 1978)
An exemption granted under subsection (7) may be amended or revoked at any time by the Director by notice in the Gazette. (L.N. 181 of 1978)

section.name: s31A
section.heading: Power of Director to grant permission

subsection.content: Notwithstanding section 30(1), in relation to the food specified in items 1(a) and 1(b) of Schedule 2, the Director may grant permission to a person to sell, or offer or expose for sale, or possess for sale at any premises the food specified in that item 1(a) or the food specified in that item 1(b) but not both at the same premises.

Notwithstanding section 30(1), in relation to the food specified in items 1(a) and 1(b) of Schedule 2, the Director may grant permission to a person to sell, or offer or expose for sale, or possess for sale at any market stall the food specified in that item 1(a) or the food specified in that item 1(b) but not both at the same market stall.

subsection.def: In subsection (1), premises (處所) means the premises on which the business of a fresh provision shop is carried on.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Application for licence

subsection.leadIn: Every application for a licence under section 31 shall be made in writing addressed to the Director and accompanied by 3 copies of a plan, as nearly as may be to scale, of the whole of the food premises (excluding a stall) to which such licence will relate, and, so far as may be applicable having regard to the nature of business, including the following particulars—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: space allocated to the cooking, preparation or handling of open food;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: space allocated to the storage of any kind of open food;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: space allocated to the serving of meals to customers;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: space allocated to the cleansing, drying or storage for ready use of utensils;

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: if the application relates to a composite food shop, the space, and equipment and furniture of a substantial and permanent nature, allocated for use in the sale, or the preparation for sale, of the food or class of food to which the licence will relate, and the siting of the space, equipment and furniture; (L.N. 57 of 2010)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: sanitary fitments and drainage works;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: cloakrooms, passageways and open spaces;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: all means of exit, entry and internal communication;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: all windows or ducts providing ventilation or, in the case of ventilation by mechanical means, such means;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the siting of all furniture of a substantial and permanent nature, including food manufacturing or preparation plant, cooking ranges, refrigeration or cooling equipment, fixed sideboards, washbasins or sinks, drying racks, water tanks and other like equipment;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: means of refuse storage and disposal;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: space allocated to the thawing of frozen articles of food and to facilities for inspection and sampling of such food. (L.N. 125 of 1970)

subsection.leadIn: Every plan submitted for approval under subsection (1) shall be accompanied by a statement in writing declaring—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the class of licence required; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the type of heating equipment and fuel intended to be used; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the type and country of manufacture of any air conditioning plant intended to be installed.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: Every plan submitted for approval under subsection (1) in an application for a composite food shop licence must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: accompanied by a statement in writing declaring the food or class of food intended to be covered by the licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: certified by an authorized person or a registered structural engineer to be in conformity with the layout of the food premises to which the application relates. (L.N. 57 of 2010)

subsection.content: Every plan or such modification thereof as is approved by the Director shall be endorsed to that effect and shall be signed by or on behalf of the Director and one copy shall be returned to the applicant and the remaining 2 copies shall be retained by the Director.

Every application for a composite food shop licence must be accompanied by a certification made by an authorized person or a registered structural engineer that, in relation to the premises in respect of which the application is made, the authorized person or registered structural engineer is satisfied as to all matters specified in section 33(1)(b), (c), (d), (e), (f), (fa), (g), (h), (i), (l) and (m). (L.N. 57 of 2010)

section.name: s33
section.heading: Conditions for issue of licence

subsection.leadIn: No full licence shall be granted under section 31 unless the Director is satisfied, in relation to the premises in respect of which the application for such licence was made, that— (L.N. 493 of 1995)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the plan referred to in section 32 has been approved by the Director and the premises conform thereto;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the means of ventilation provided, whether natural or mechanical or partly natural and partly mechanical, are sufficient in every part of the premises, other than any part used exclusively for storage purposes, to safeguard in that respect the maximum number of person likely to be in such part of the premises at any one time;

content.leadIn: sanitary fitments are provided to a standard not less than that required by the Building (Standards of Sanitary Fitments, Plumbing, Drainage Works and Latrines) Regulations (Cap. 123 sub. leg. I):
content.proviso: Provided that in the case of any premises to which such regulations do not apply, the Director may approve such lesser standard as, having regard to considerations of public health and the circumstances of the case, he may consider adequate;

content.leadIn: public mains water is laid on to the premises and that adequate tank storage suitably protected against access of dust and mosquitoes is provided:
content.proviso: Provided that where the Director is satisfied that public mains water cannot reasonably be laid on, for all or any purpose, the Director may in his discretion approve such other water supply as, having regard to consideration of public health, he considers adequate;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: the floors of every food room are surfaced with smooth, light coloured and non-absorbent material; (L.N. 57 of 2010)

paragraph.name: fa
paragraph.content: the internal surfaces of the walls of every food room are surfaced with smooth and non-absorbent material up to a height of not less than 2 m and the junctions between the walls and floors of every food room are coved; (L.N. 57 of 2010)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the ceilings of every food room are rendered impervious to dust;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the facilities for cleansing equipment and utensils used in the preparation, service or consumption of food on the premises are adequate having regard to the nature of the food business to be carried on; (L.N. 57 of 2010)

content.leadIn: except where adequate provision is made elsewhere, suitable and sufficient cupboard or locker accommodation is provided for clothing and footwear not worn during working hours of all persons engaged in the handling of food on or about the premises:

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: this requirement shall not apply to food premises upon which no open food is handled; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: this requirement may be waived or modified by the Director by notice in writing;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: the surface of every article of furniture referred to in section 17 is capable of being lit to a standard of not less than 90 lux, and the top plates of every stove and cooking range are capable of being lit to a standard of not less than 65 lux, either by natural or artificial lighting or partly by natural and partly by artificial lighting; (L.N. 89 of 1979; L.N. 57 of 2010)

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: any heating equipment or air conditioning plant provided is properly installed and, having regard to the nature of the premises, is not likely to be dangerous; (L.N. 57 of 2010)

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.leadIn: if the application relates to a general restaurant—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at least one kitchen is provided; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the area of the food room, or if there is more than one food room, the aggregate area of the food rooms, is not less, or less in proportion to the gross floor area, than that prescribed in Part 1 of Schedule 5A; (L.N. 57 of 2010)

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: if the application relates to a light refreshment restaurant, the area of the food room, or if there is more than one food room, the aggregate area of the food rooms, is not less, or less in proportion to the gross floor area, than that prescribed in Part 2 of Schedule 5A; and (L.N. 57 of 2010)

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: if the application relates to a factory canteen, the area of the food room, or if there is more than one food room, the aggregate area of the food rooms, is not less, or less in proportion to the gross floor area, than that prescribed in Part 3 of Schedule 5A. (L.N. 57 of 2010)

subsection.content: Where the premises in respect of which such application is made are a vessel, the provisions of subsection (1) shall apply subject to such modification as is appropriate.

section.name: s33A
section.heading: Additional requirement for issue of licence for siu mei and lo mei shops
section.content: No licence shall be granted by the Director in respect of a siu mei and lo mei shop unless the Director is satisfied that the premises in respect of which the application is made are not being used for the sale of fresh or chilled meat.

section.name: s33B
section.heading: Compliance with fire safety requirements
section.content: No licence shall be granted by the Director under section 31 unless the applicant for such licence produces to the Director a certificate from the Director of Fire Services, or a registered fire engineer (fire service installation) (as defined by section 2 of the Fire Services Ordinance (Cap. 95)), and such other evidence as the Director may require to the effect that the premises in respect of which the application is made comply with any requirements issued by the Director of Fire Services, or a registered fire engineer (risk assessment) (as defined by section 2 of that Ordinance). This section does not apply to the issue of a provisional licence under section 33C.

section.name: s33C
section.heading: Provisional licence

subsection.leadIn: The Director may on application grant a provisional licence permitting the carrying on of any food business mentioned in section 31(1) where the applicant satisfies the Director— (L.N. 349 of 1998)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the conditions mentioned in sections 33(1)(b), (c), (d), (e), (f), (fa), (g), (h), (i), (m), (n), (o) and (p) and 33A have been complied with; and (L.N. 57 of 2010)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that any requirements issued by the Director of Fire Services, or a registered fire engineer (risk assessment) (as defined by section 2 of the Fire Services Ordinance (Cap. 95)), have been complied with. (L.N. 349 of 1998; 1 of 2017 s. 13)

subsection.content: The Director shall not consider an application for a provisional licence unless the applicant has applied to the Director for a full licence for the carrying on of any food business mentioned in section 31(1) in respect of the same premises. (L.N. 349 of 1998)
A provisional licence shall be valid for a period of 6 months from and including the date of its issue.
A provisional licence may be renewed on one occasion, and only on one occasion at the absolute discretion of the Director.

A provisional licence that is renewed under subsection (4) shall be valid for a period of 6 months from and including the date of its renewal or such lesser period as may be specified in the provisional licence.
The fee for the grant or renewal of a provisional licence shall be the prescribed fee. (L.N. 85 of 2013)

If a full licence is granted before the expiry of a provisional licence, any refund of part of the fee paid in respect of the provisional licence will be made on a pro-rata basis. Any fraction of $1 in the refund shall count as $1.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Restriction on alteration of premises or fittings after grant of licence
section.leadIn: After the grant or renewal of any licence under this Regulation, except with the written permission of the Director, no licensee shall, in respect of the premises in relation to which such licence was granted, cause or permit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any alteration or addition which would result in material deviation from the plan approved under section 32; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any alteration in respect of any matter specified in section 33; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to any heating equipment, any alteration of any part of such equipment or any change in the type of fuel used therein.

section.name: s34A
section.heading: Transfer of licence
section.content: Save with the consent in writing of the Director, a person to whom a full licence has been granted under section 31 or a provisional licence has been granted under section 33C shall not transfer his full or provisional licence to any person.

section.name: s34B
section.heading: Licensee to exhibit licence
section.content: Where a licence is granted under this Regulation, the licensee shall exhibit and keep exhibited such licence at a conspicuous place near the entrance of the premises to which such licence relates.

section.name: s34C
section.heading: Food business otherwise than at the place delineated in the plan
section.content: No licensee shall, save with the permission in writing of the Director, carry on or cause, permit or suffer to be carried on a food business at or from any place beyond the confines of the food premises as delineated on the plan approved under section 32 in respect of his licence.

section.name: s34D
section.heading: Alteration or addition to the matters specified in section 32(1)

subsection.content: No licensee shall, save with the permission in writing of the Director, make or cause, permit or suffer to be made any alteration or addition to the matters specified in the plan approved under section 32 in respect of the food premises.

subsection.leadIn: No licensee shall, save with the permission in writing of the Director, add or cause, permit or suffer to be added within or to the food premises to which the licence relates—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: space for any of the purposes specified in section 32(1)(a), (b), (c), (d), (da) or (k); or (L.N. 57 of 2010)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sanitary fitments and drainage works, cloakrooms, passageways and open spaces, means of exit, entry and internal communication, windows or ducts (or means of ventilation), furniture of a substantial and permanent nature or means of refuse storage and disposal of the kind specified in paragraph (e), (f), (g), (h), (i) or (j) of section 32(1) respectively,

subsection.continued: which is or are not specified in the plan approved under section 32 in respect of the food premises.

section.name: s34E
section.heading: False certification
section.content: Without prejudice to section 125(1)(b) of the Ordinance, if a composite food shop licence is granted on an application under section 32, and the plan or certification referred to in section 32(2A), or the certification referred to in section 32(4), that is submitted in connection with the application is found to be false or misleading in a material particular, the Director may cancel the licence.

section.name: s34F
section.heading: Partial suspension or cancellation of licence
section.content: Without prejudice to section 125(1)(b) of the Ordinance, a composite food shop licence or a provisional licence granted in respect of a composite food shop may be suspended or cancelled to the extent that it is related to any particular food or particular class of food covered by the licence.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Offences and penalties

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: being a person engaged in the course of any food business, in any food room or in any room in which food is served or in the handling of open food—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: fails to submit himself to medical examination when required to do so under section 24(2); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: fails to cease to work or to take part in any food business when required to do so by the provisions of that subsection,

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence.

subsection.content: In the event of any contravention of any of the provisions of section 15, 16 or 27, the licensee of the food business in relation to which the contravention occurred shall be guilty of an offence.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who is guilty of an offence under this Regulation shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine and imprisonment as follows and, where the offence is a continuing offence, to an additional fine as follows for each day during which it is proved to the satisfaction of the court that the offence has continued—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an offence under subsection (1) for contravening section 29, 30(1), 30A, 30D(1) or (2), 30F or 31(1), a fine at level 5, imprisonment for 6 months and $900 for each day as aforesaid; (L.N. 454 of 1995; L.N. 177 of 1996; L.N. 171 of 1998; L.N. 220 of 2001; L.N. 265 of 2001; L.N. 169 of 2006)

paragraph.name: aaa
paragraph.content: for an offence under subsection (1) for contravening section 30AA(1), a fine at level 5 and imprisonment for 6 months; (L.N. 185 of 2008)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: for an offence under subsection (1) for contravening section 30(1A), (1C), (1E) or (1G), 30B or 30C(1), a fine at level 4; (L.N. 265 of 2001)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an offence under subsection (1) for a contravention other than those referred to in paragraphs (a), (aaa) and (aa), an offence under subsection (2), or an offence under section 5(5), a fine at level 3, imprisonment for 3 months and $300 for each day as aforesaid. (L.N. 181 of 1978; L.N. 175 of 1980; L.N. 291 of 1987; L.N. 177 of 1996; L.N. 57 of 2010)

section.name: s36
section.heading: Name in which proceedings for offences may be brought
section.content: Without prejudice to the provisions of any other enactment relating to the prosecution of criminal offences and without prejudice to the powers of the Secretary for Justice in relation to the prosecution of such offences, prosecutions for an offence under any of the provisions of this Regulation may be brought in the name of the Director.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Transitional arrangement for existing licence holders

subsection.leadIn: The amendments in the Amendment Regulation apply, with effect from the specified date but not earlier, in relation to a holder of a licence which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is granted under section 31 in respect of a fresh provision shop; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is in force immediately before the commencement date and is in force on the specified date.

subsection.leadIn: The amendments in the Amendment Regulation do not apply in relation to a holder of a licence which is granted under section 31 in respect of a fresh provision shop and which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is in force immediately before the commencement date and is in force on that date; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ceases to have effect on or before the specified date.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Amendment Regulation (《修訂規例》) means the Food Business (Amendment) Regulation 2001 (L.N. 220 of 2001);
*commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the Amendment Regulation comes into operation;
specified date (指明日期) means the date next following the expiry of the period of 60 days beginning on the commencement date. (L.N. 264 of 2001)

section.name: s38
section.heading: Transitional requirements for restaurants and factory canteens

subsection.content: In relation to a restaurant or factory canteen in respect of which a licence was granted under section 31 before 1 August 2010 (relevant date), section 33(1)(j), (ja), (k), (ka) and (kb) (repealed provisions) as in force immediately before the relevant date continues to apply as if it had not been repealed, and section 34(b) and Schedules 4 and 5 are to have effect accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to a restaurant or factory canteen in respect of which a licence was granted under section 31 before the relevant date, if any alteration is made on or after the relevant date in respect of any matter specified in the repealed provisions applicable to it under subsection (1), and the written permission of the Director referred to in section 34 is given in respect of the alteration—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (1) ceases to apply on the date of the written permission; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 33(1)(n), (o) or (p) applies to the restaurant or factory canteen as if a licence were granted in respect of it under section 31 on or after the relevant date.

subsection.content: The repealed provisions are set out in Schedule 7.

schedule.name: sch6
schedule.heading: Marking and Labelling of Pre-packaged Chilled Beef, Mutton or Pork

section.name: s1
section.heading: Name or designation
section.content: Pre-packaged chilled beef, mutton or pork shall be legibly marked or labelled with the name or designation of the food.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Indication of “slaughtering” and “use by” dates

subsection.content: Pre-packaged chilled beef, mutton or pork shall be legibly marked or labelled with the “slaughtering date” and the “use by” date.
The “slaughtering date” shall be indicated by the words “slaughtering date” in English lettering and by Chinese characters “屠宰日期” followed by the date on which the animal was slaughtered.

subsection.leadIn: The “use by” date shall be indicated by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the words “use by” in English lettering and by Chinese characters “此日期或之前食用” followed by the date up to and including which the pre-packaged chilled beef, mutton or pork, if properly stored, is recommended for use; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement of conditions for storage which need to be observed if the pre-packaged chilled beef, mutton or pork is to retain its quality attributes until that date.

subsection.content: The “slaughtering date” and the “use by” date shall be shown either in Arabic numerals or in both the English and Chinese languages and, subject to subsection (6), shall be expressed in terms of a day, a month and a year.

The “slaughtering date” and the “use by” date may appear on the labelling of the pre-packaged chilled beef, mutton or pork separately from the words immediately preceding the date, if those words are followed by a reference to the place where the date appears.

subsection.leadIn: Where the “slaughtering date” and the “use by” date are shown in Arabic numerals—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the day shall be indicated by the words “DD”, “dd”, “D” or “d” in English lettering and by Chinese character “日”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the month shall be indicated by the words “MM”, “mm”, “M” or “m” in English lettering and by Chinese character “月”; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the year shall be indicated by the words “YY”, “yy”, “Y” or “y” in English lettering and by Chinese character “年”,

subsection.continued: and the day, month and year can appear in any order.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Name and address of slaughtering plant
section.content: Pre-packaged chilled beef, mutton or pork shall be legibly marked or labelled with the business name and the full address of the slaughtering plant.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Net weight

subsection.content: Pre-packaged chilled beef, mutton or pork shall be legibly marked or labelled with its net weight.

The net weight shall, so far as is practicable, be indicated in accordance with the Weights and Measures Ordinance (Cap. 68) or with the International System of Units set out in the First Schedule to the Metrication Ordinance (Cap. 214).

section.name: s5
section.heading: Appropriate language
section.content: The marking and labelling for the purposes of sections 1, 2(1), 3 and 4 shall be in the English language or Chinese language or in both languages, but if both languages are used for any such marking or labelling, the name or designation of the food under section 1 shall be shown in both languages.
